financial_overview.revenue: Information on V-Art's revenue is not publicly available. Based on its stage (Seed) and employee count (5), revenue is likely still in the early stages of development.
financial_overview.profitability: V-Art is likely not yet profitable given its Seed stage and focus on scaling its platform. Profitability is a future goal, dependent on successful customer acquisition and monetization of its IP licensing platform.
financial_overview.burn_rate: Information on V-Art's burn rate is not publicly available. As a Seed-stage startup, managing burn rate is crucial to extend its runway and achieve key milestones. The Google Accelerator program should help optimize resource allocation.
financial_overview.runway: Information on V-Art's runway is not publicly available. The $1.4M seed funding should provide a runway to achieve key milestones such as launching AI-driven bulk licensing and scaling dataset licensing for LLMs. The actual length of the runway will depend on the burn rate.

financial_metrics.customer_acquisition_cost: Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) data is not publicly available. As a B2B company targeting brands and AI teams, CAC likely involves sales and marketing efforts focused on demonstrating the value proposition of V-Art's platform.
financial_metrics.lifetime_value: Lifetime Value (LTV) data is not publicly available. LTV will depend on the subscription model or transaction fees associated with IP licensing through the V-Art platform.
financial_metrics.gross_margin: Gross Margin data is not publicly available. The gross margin will depend on the cost of providing the AI-enabled, blockchain-powered technology and the pricing strategy for the platform.
financial_metrics.recurring_revenue: Recurring Revenue data is not publicly available. If V-Art adopts a subscription-based model, recurring revenue will be a key metric for assessing the sustainability of the business.
